snippet: Lakhdar Brahimi said there were many signs that Syria’s government was planning an election, though that would be counterproductive for talks.
abstract: Lakhdar Brahimi, United Nations mediator who has sought negotiations in Syrian war, says holding elections there would doom prospects for future talks by negating need for interim government, central tenet of negotiations; comments come as Syria draws closer to scheduling national polls.
lead_paragraph: Lakhdar Brahimi said there were many signs that Syria’s government was planning an election, though that would be counterproductive for talks.

headline.main: Amid Preparations, Mediator Says Syria Vote Would Doom Talks
headline.print_headline: Amid Preparations, Mediator Says Syria Vote Would Doom Talks

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
